projects.title: Personal Website
projects.meta: React, MaterialUI, Firebase, CI/CD, JavaScript, HTML, CSS
projects.info: This is my little corner on the internet. The frontend was created using React and I'm using Firebase for the backend. Messages submitted through the contact form are stored using the Cloud Firestore database. This site is also auto-deployed using a CI/CD pipeline set up using GitHub Actions.

projects.title: PixArt
projects.meta: Vanilla JavaScript, HTML, CSS - No libraries!
projects.info: I created this project to challenge myself and take my JavaScript skills to the next level. The app allows users to sketch a drawing with the ability to adjust the grid size, erase, and change the pen/background colour.

projects.title: Rock Paper Scissors
projects.meta: Vanilla JavaScript, HTML, CSS - No libraries!
projects.info: My first project-based introduction to JavaScript.

projects.title: Monkey Business
projects.meta: Vanilla HTML and CSS - No libraries!
projects.info: This is my first ever webpage! Creating this landing page was a great way for me to learn the fundamentals of HTML and CSS.

projects.title: Bike Frame and Welding Jig
projects.description: Engineering a bike frame from scratch
projects.info: This was one of the projects I had working as an R&D Engineer Intern at UWaterloo. The purpose of this project was to create a bike frame from scratch to learn the fundamentals of bike and jig design. Overall, it was a great way to develop my design, analytical, and engineering skills.

projects.title: Lifecycle Testing Machine
projects.info: This project was one of the undertakings I had as an R&D Engineer Intern at UWaterloo. The purpose of the project was to explore the accuracy of finite element software and real life results of cyclic loading on an armchair. I designed and built the machine from scratch and programmed an Arduino to automate the linear actuator.

experience.info: During my internship at Toyota, I led an investigation into reducing the factory chilled water production in the car manufacturing process using the Toyota Business Practice problem solving model. This Kaizen consisted of conducting root cause analysis, developing countermeasures, analyzing the results, and Yokoten. My proposal was to re-use a defunct mechanical system on site which had the potential to reduce costs by a forecasted 74% and have a payback period of 6 months. At the end of my term, I had the opportunity to present this study to senior management. Another noteworthy project that I led was migrating a paper based approval process for utility requests into electronic format by developing a virtual portal. I created multiple iterations and trial and error with other departments prior to full deployment. The project was well-received and will save countless man-hours at Toyota.

My primary focus in this role was creating a custom bike frame, welding jig, and an armchair lifecycle testing machine. I brought all of these projects from start to finish alongside my coworkers and technicians. I led the whole design process which consisted of 3D modelling, creating engineering drawings, finite element analysis, preparing bill of materials, machining, programming an Arduino, and assembly. Some other projects/activities that I was involved with include developing a pizza kitchen simulation for Management Sciences students to explore during class labs, providing technical support for student design days, and showcasing our projects at virtual open houses.
